result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam C. Pharr

records.addlTxt:
8:36 AM Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Adam C. Pharr in court.  Attorney Jillian Jean Scheidegger in court for Adam C. Pharr. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Attorney Scheidegger advises the Court that the matter is resolved and is requesting a plea/sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
filed by Attorney Jillian J. Scheidegger
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Adam C. Pharr, appeared with Attorney Jillian Jean Scheidegger.  Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued. DE must be booked after today's hearing.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Rhyen B

Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on July 27, 2022 at 09:15 am. $1500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  sg
